intro: Pisonia myrtifrons, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Pisonia myrtifrons is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
